Solidity Underhanded Contest

Inspired by the Underhanded C Contest and the first Underhanded Solidity Contest, organized in 2017 by Nick Johnson, the Solidity Underhanded Contest is finally back!

The goal of this contest is to write innocent-looking Solidity code, which pretends to be a clear and straightforward smart contract, but actually implement malicious behavior.


  • Learn more

Theme

This year's theme are upgradable contracts, or, more specifically upgrade mechanisms (also known as proxies).

Judges

Judges are presented with anonymised submissions. The submissions will be assessed by:

    Christian Reitwiessner, Solidity Lead Developer at Ethereum Foundation
    Goncalo Sa, Security Engineer at ConsenSys Diligence
    Stefan Beyer, Auditor at Solidified
  • Learn more

Prizes

Phasellus convallis elit id ullamcorper pulvinar. Duis aliquam turpis mauris, eu ultricies erat malesuada quis. Aliquam dapibus.

  • Learn more

Coding Brief & Rules

All you need to know about participation and submission!

Brief

Design an upgrade mechanism that looks “safe” (with opt-in/opt-out option) but has a backdoor.

Plausability
